data.title: DVD Round-Up - Week of October 5: My Life in Ruins, Year One, Trick 'r' Treat, Anvil: The Story of Anvil
data.meta_description: October has begun, bringing with it the tide of Halloween releases I so look forward to. But apparently, not everybody defines their existence by the number of
data.text:
Postmedia may earn an affiliate commission from purchases made through our links on this page.

Article content

October has begun, bringing with it the tide of Halloween releases I so look forward to. But apparently, not everybody defines their existence by the number of Evil Dead DVD re-releases they can fit on a shelf, so there are actually a few non-horror titles being released this month. Here are some of the more popular home video releases for the week of October 5th, according to Amazon.com.

My Life in Ruins

Apparently, Nia Vardalos has spent the years since My Big Fat Greek Wedding not honing her craft, but rather practicing her ethnic stereotyping. Thatâ€™s the only explanation I can think of for My Life In Ruins, in which she plays a tour guide showing boorish tourists how to make fun of Greece.

Year One

In theory, Jack Blackâ€™s mania and Michael Ceraâ€™s gangly awkwardness should have propelled this caveman comedy to the next level. Instead, it turns out the two styles of humour cancel each other out, leaving an uncomfortable vacuum where the laughter should go.

Trick â€˜râ€™ Treat

One of the side effects of constantly watching movies is that my attention span can now only be measured in quantum terms. That makes me extra appreciative of anthology films like Trick â€˜râ€™ Treat, which brings together four short, Halloween-themed horror stories.

Anvil: The Story of Anvil

Imagine if Spinal Tap were real, Canadian and good. Wait, thatâ€™s 3 Inches of Blood. Okay, then letâ€™s pretend Dio never made it out of the gate, and then youâ€™ve got Canadian heavy metal band Anvil, the subject of this popular documentary.
